snippet: The partisan fiscal showdown that is set to unfold in the weeks between Election Day and Inauguration Day is expected to set the tone for the next administration, no matter who wins.
abstract: Political Memo; partisan fiscal showdown that is set to unfold in the weeks between Election Day and Inauguration Day is expected to set the tone for the next administration, no matter who wins the presidency; without agreement of some kind, more than $700 billion in automatic tax increases and spending cuts will occur on Dec 31.
lead_paragraph: The partisan fiscal showdown that is set to unfold in the weeks between Election Day and Inauguration Day is expected to set the tone for the next administration, no matter who wins.

headline.seo: Budget Crisis Likely to Define Obama or Romney Term
headline.main: Debt Impasse Shadows Race for Presidency
headline.print_headline: Debt Impasse Shadows Race For Presidency
